(SCTP) Programme for the Lean Six Sigma Champion and Operational Excellence Manager
(SCTP) Programme for the Lean Six Sigma Champion and Operational Excellence Manager
A 3 months programme designed specifically for mid-career professionals aiming to elevate proficiency in Lean and Six Sigma methodologies.
Lean and Six Sigma, Business Management

The (SCTP) Programme for the Lean Six Sigma Champion and Operational Excellence Manager is a career transition programme strategically structured around the principles of Lean and Six Sigma methodologies.

Improving business operations not only benefits the bottom line but also leads to improvements in quality, reliability, service excellence, and safety for both employees and customers. Every organisation stands to gain from a Lean expert and operations excellence manager.

The pivotal role of a Lean Six Sigma executive, leader, or manager addresses a diverse range of challenges through specialised skills, adaptability, and strategic insights. This involves managing resistance to change and driving cultural transformation. It also includes excelling in data analysis, prioritising strategic projects, and fostering effective cross-functional collaboration. Additionally, it involves balancing standardisation and flexibility, ensuring knowledge transfer, and adapting to dynamic environments.

Lean Six Sigma experts blend technical prowess with leadership, communication and a deep understanding of their organisation's dynamics to navigate organisational challenges effectively while upholding the core principles of Lean Six Sigma for sustained impact.
At its core, this programme furnishes comprehensive insights into Lean and Six Sigma methodologies, including:
DMAIC (Design, Measure, Analyse, Improve, Control) methodology for structured process enhancement
These proficiencies find application not only industrial production but are relevant across diverse domains such as healthcare and services.
In this programme, you will hone your managerial acumen across various domains and competencies including:
Fostering a culture of continuous improvement
Leveraging performance metrics to steer organisational advancement
Adeptly coaching and mentoring team members
Making informed business decisions utilising financial tools
Nurturing innovation within specific organisational segments
Upon completing the project deliverables within six months of finishing the programme, you will be awarded with the
Lean Six Sigma Green Belt qualification

This comprehensive Lean Expert Toolkit empowers you to advance in your career, excel as a skilled manager, and become influential catalysts for change within your chosen domain. It equips you with the necessary skills and a
valuable industry-recognised credential to elevate your role and drive impactful transformation in your domain.
Additional benefit for all learners: One hour of project coaching support is included within six months of completing the learning programme.
Executives, specialists, leaders and managers engaged in the following capacities will gain significant benefits from this programme:
Applicants should possess a formal education in any discipline
Applicants may be invited for an interview prior to admission to the programme

The future will be different without a doubt, and we can only prepare ourselves to face them. If we believe that our greatest assets are our people, then continuous workplace learning helps unleash their potential. The Lean training courses at SIT have been one of our key learning platforms to help hone a generation of our leadership team to tackle these challenges ahead.
Managing Director, Core Concepts Pte. Ltd.

Learning the Lean methodology has greatly changed my perspective on resolving problems and improvement efforts. I believe the department will benefit from improved efficiency due to its exposure to many problem-solving tools, despite the limitations we face. Indeed, when a system is good, it will run on its own. Workplace learning is an essential part of the healthcare business, as change is the only constant, and we need to learn to embrace these changes or challenges.
Principal Radiographer, Ng Teng Fong General Hospital
Structured DMAIC (Design, Measure, Analyse, Improve, Control) process for methodical process enhancement

Yoong Fook Loy is currently an Associate Faculty of SIT, specialising in Lean. He is currently the Managing Director of Centre for Performance Transformation that enable business transformation through process, people and business modelling. He also represents Pivotal Resources in Asia as the Managing Consultant for Lean and Six Sigma.  He has been providing in-depth consulting, training and hands-on deployment in Socio-technical system of Organisation Design and Development since 1995.

Fook Loy spent nearly 12 years at General Electric (GE) and has the opportunity to work in different businesses.  He held various positions in Operation, Human Resources Development and Six Sigma. His last rotation in GE was as Corporate Leadership Program Manager for Asia, overseeing talent development in numerous GE Leadership Programs before moving into the area of Lean Six Sigma Consulting in 2002.  As a Corporate Leadership Programme Manager, Fook Loy was involved in nurturing and mentoring over 200+ leaders in Asia, being very involved in training and coaching these leaders in their Six Sigma projects.

As a Certified Lean Six Sigma Master Black Belt, Fook Loy provide consulting, coaching and training services to various Multinational companies, among those are Air Products, Givaudan Asia Pacific, Cathay Pacific, Halliburton, Far East Organization, Continental Automotive, National Health Group Singapore, Nanyang Technological University  and others. He is also an adjunct Lecturer with Nanyang Technological University, supporting the Centre for Professional and Adult Continuing Education.

Fook Loy graduated with a Bachelor of Business Administration from The Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology. He is also a certified Lean Launchpad Educator (University of California, Berkeley), an accredited Design Thinker, (Stanford Design School), a Master Trainer and Consultant for High Performance Work Organization and a Certified Gallup Strengths- Finder Coach. Fook Loy is also an accredited facilitator in the Myer Brigg Type Indicator, Belbin Team Role, and the Leadership Challenge.
Senior Consultant, Centre for Performance Transformation
Senior Consultant, Centre for Performance Transformation

Thomas Chew is a certified Lean Master, Six Sigma Black Belt and Kaizen Coach with 24 years of experience in various industries. He has just returned from his expat assignment in Kazakhstan, where he supported Shell as a Continuous Improvement Master Coach. His other assignments with Shell included being on assignment at Norske Shell (upstream) in Norway, where he developed fit-for-purpose Lean training programmes. The training laid the foundation to support the roll-out of the fit-for-future initiative. A major contribution was in his role as CI Lead for Global Key Account (GKA) and Specialties (Europe), where he supported the simplification efforts in the Tender Assessment Process, reducing lead-time from 50 days to 14 days, amongst others.

Thomas’ Lean journey started at ST Kinetics in 1999, when he was involved in the company-wide Lean initiative. He received Gemba Kaizen training and mentoring under Shingijutsu Co. Ltd. He provided training for 1400 employees and facilitated and coached close to 100 projects. His other exposure to Lean was with Honeywell Aerospace, where he was the Lean Master with APAC responsibilities to deploy the Honeywell Operating System.

As a senior consultant with the Centre for Performance Transformation, Thomas provides Lean Six Sigma and people transformation training and consulting services to various organizations in healthcare, banking, government institutions, oil and gas, aerospace, and automotive in Singapore and the ASEAN region. Thomas graduated with a BSc in Management (2
Upper) from the University of London (1998).

All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
This is a Union Training Assistance Programme (UTAP) supported course.
Additional Course Fee Funding Support Criteria
To be eligible for 95% additional course fee funding support, applicants must be a Singapore Citizen and meet one of the following criteria:
Long-term unemployed individual (unemployed for six months or more); or

Individual in need of financial assistance – ComCare Short-to-Medium Term Assistance (SMTA) recipient or Workfare Income Supplement (WIS) recipient. Additionally, they should not have received any other funding from government sources in respect of the actual grant disbursed for the programme.
